content: Which American inventor is best known for his development of the electric light bulb and the phonograph?

Thomas Edison is the American inventor who is best known for his development of the electric light bulb and the phonograph. He was a prolific inventor with over 1,000 patents to his name, and his innovations had a profound impact on the world. In addition to the light bulb and phonograph, Edison also developed the motion picture camera and played a crucial role in the development of the modern electric power industry. His work laid the foundation for many of the technological advancements we enjoy today.
